service: This API reference provides descriptions, syntax, and other details about each of the actions and data types for AWS Systems Manager for SAP. The topic for each action shows the API request parameters and responses.

operations.DeleteResourcePermission: Removes permissions associated with the target database.
operations.DeregisterApplication: Deregister an SAP application with AWS Systems Manager for SAP. This action does not aï¬€ect the existing setup of your SAP workloads on Amazon EC2.
operations.GetApplication: Gets an application registered with AWS Systems Manager for SAP. It also returns the components of the application.
operations.GetComponent: Gets the component of an application registered with AWS Systems Manager for SAP.
operations.GetDatabase: Gets the SAP HANA database of an application registered with AWS Systems Manager for SAP.
operations.GetOperation: Gets the details of an operation by specifying the operation ID.
operations.GetResourcePermission: Gets permissions associated with the target database.
operations.ListApplications: Lists all the applications registered with AWS Systems Manager for SAP.
operations.ListComponents: Lists all the components registered with AWS Systems Manager for SAP.
operations.ListDatabases: Lists the SAP HANA databases of an application registered with AWS Systems Manager for SAP.
operations.ListOperations: Lists the operations performed by AWS Systems Manager for SAP.
operations.ListTagsForResource: Lists all tags on an SAP HANA application and/or database registered with AWS Systems Manager for SAP.
operations.RegisterApplication:
Register an SAP application with AWS Systems Manager for SAP. You must meet the following requirements before registering.

The SAP application you want to register with AWS Systems Manager for SAP is running on Amazon EC2.

AWS Systems Manager Agent must be setup on an Amazon EC2 instance along with the required IAM permissions.

Amazon EC2 instance(s) must have access to the secrets created in AWS Secrets Manager to manage SAP applications and components.
operations.TagResource: Creates tag for a resource by specifying the ARN.
operations.UpdateApplicationSettings: Updates the settings of an application registered with AWS Systems Manager for SAP.

refs.Application$AppRegistryArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Application Registry.
refs.GetApplicationInput$AppRegistryArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the application registry.

Application.base: An SAP application registered with AWS Systems Manager for SAP.

refs.GetApplicationOutput$Application: Returns all of the metadata of an application registered with AWS Systems Manager for SAP.
refs.RegisterApplicationOutput$Application: The application registered with AWS Systems Manager for SAP.

refs.UpdateApplicationSettingsInput$Credentia: The credentials to be added or updated.

refs.Application$DiscoveryStatus: The latest discovery result for the application.

ApplicationSummary.base: The summary of the SAP application registered with AWS Systems Manager for SAP.

refs.ListApplicationsOutput$Applications: The applications registered with AWS Systems Manager for SAP.

refs.DeleteResourcePermissionInput$SourceReso: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the source resource.
refs.DeleteResourcePermissionInput$ResourceAr: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.
refs.GetResourcePermissionInput$ResourceArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.
refs.Operation$ResourceArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the operation.

AssociatedHost.base: Describes the properties of the associated host.

BackintConfig.base: Configuration parameters for AWS Backint Agent for SAP HANA. You can backup your SAP HANA database with AWS Backup or Amazon S3.

refs.UpdateApplicationSettingsInput$Backint: Installation of AWS Backint Agent for SAP HANA.

refs.GetComponentOutput$Component: The component of an application registered with AWS Systems Manager for SAP.

refs.Component$ParentComponent: The parent component of a highly available environment. For example, in a highly available SAP on AWS workload, the parent component consists of the entire setup, including the child components.

refs.Component$ChildComponents: The child components of a highly available environment. For example, in a highly available SAP on AWS workload, the child component consists of the primary and secondar instances.

refs.ListComponentsOutput$Components: List of components registered with AWS System Manager for SAP.

Database.base: The SAP HANA database of the application registered with AWS Systems Manager for SAP.

refs.GetDatabaseOutput$Database: The SAP HANA database of an application registered with AWS Systems Manager for SAP.

refs.Database$DatabaseId: The ID of the SAP HANA database.

refs.Component$Databases: The SAP HANA databases of the component.

refs.ApplicationCredential$DatabaseName: The name of the SAP HANA database.

refs.ListDatabasesOutput$Databases: The SAP HANA databases of an application.

Filter.base: A specific result obtained by specifying the name, value, and operator.

refs.Filter$Name: The name of the filter. Filter names are case-sensitive.

refs.Filter$Value: The filter values. Filter values are case-sensitive. If you specify multiple values for a filter, the values are joined with an OR, and the request returns all results that match any of the specified values

Host.base: Describes the properties of the Dedicated Host.

refs.RegisterApplicationInput$Instances: The Amazon EC2 instances on which your SAP application is running.

refs.ListApplicationsInput$MaxResults: The maximum number of results to return with a single call. To retrieve the remaining results, make another call with the returned nextToken value.
refs.ListComponentsInput$MaxResults:
The maximum number of results to return with a single call. To retrieve the remaining results, make another call with the returned nextToken value.

If you do not specify a value for MaxResults, the request returns 50 items per page by default.
refs.ListDatabasesInput$MaxResults: The maximum number of results to return with a single call. To retrieve the remaining results, make another call with the returned nextToken value. If you do not specify a value for MaxResults, the request returns 50 items per page by default.
refs.ListOperationsInput$MaxResults: The maximum number of results to return with a single call. To retrieve the remaining results, make another call with the returned nextToken value. If you do not specify a value for MaxResults, the request returns 50 items per page by default.

refs.ListApplicationsInput$NextToken: The token for the next page of results.
refs.ListApplicationsOutput$NextToken: The token to use to retrieve the next page of results. This value is null when there are no more results to return.
refs.ListComponentsInput$NextToken: The token for the next page of results.
refs.ListComponentsOutput$NextToken: The token to use to retrieve the next page of results. This value is null when there are no more results to return.
refs.ListDatabasesInput$NextToken: The token for the next page of results.
refs.ListDatabasesOutput$NextToken: The token to use to retrieve the next page of results. This value is null when there are no more results to return.
refs.ListOperationsInput$NextToken: The token for the next page of results.
refs.ListOperationsOutput$NextToken: The token to use to retrieve the next page of results. This value is null when there are no more results to return.

Operation.base: The operations performed by AWS Systems Manager for SAP.

refs.ListOperationsOutput$Operations: List of operations performed by AWS Systems Manager for SAP.

refs.DeleteResourcePermissionInput$ActionType: Delete or restore the permissions on the target database.

Resilience.base: Details of the SAP HANA system replication for the instance.

refs.Component$Resilience: Details of the SAP HANA system replication for the component.

refs.RegisterApplicationInput$SapInstanceNumb: The SAP instance number of the application.

refs.ApplicationCredential$SecretId: The secret ID created in AWS Secrets Manager to store the credentials of the SAP application.

refs.Application$Arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the application.
refs.ApplicationSummary$Arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the application.
refs.Component$Arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the component.
refs.ComponentSummary$Arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the component summary.
refs.Database$Arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the database.
refs.DatabaseSummary$Arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the database.
refs.GetApplicationInput$ApplicationArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the application.
refs.GetDatabaseInput$DatabaseArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the database.
refs.ListTagsForResourceRequest$resourceArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.
refs.TagResourceRequest$resourceArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.
refs.UntagResourceRequest$resourceArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.

refs.AssociatedHost$Ec2InstanceId: The ID of the Amazon EC2 instance.
refs.Component$HdbVersion: The SAP HANA version of the component.
refs.DeleteResourcePermissionOutput$Policy: The policy that removes permissions on the target database.
refs.Host$HostIp: The IP address of the Dedicated Host.
refs.Host$InstanceId: The instance ID of the instance on the Dedicated Host.

refs.UntagResourceRequest$tagKeys: Adds/updates or removes credentials for applications registered with AWS Systems Manager for SAP.

refs.RegisterApplicationInput$Tags: The tags to be attached to the SAP application.

refs.Application$LastUpdated: The time at which the application was last updated.
refs.Component$LastUpdated: The time at which the component was last updated.
refs.Database$LastUpdated: The time at which the database was last updated.
refs.Operation$LastUpdatedTime: The time at which the operation was last updated.

ValidationException.base: The input fails to satisfy the constraints specified by an AWS service.
